intro: Catabrosella humilis, commonly known as the dwarf catabrosella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to arid conditions. Catabrosella humilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
